title: 113_hr3202
content: The Act titled "Essential Transportation Worker Identification Credential Assessment Act" mandates a comprehensive security assessment of the Transportation Security Card Program. The Secretary of Homeland Security must provide a comprehensive assessment of the transportation security card program's effectiveness in enhancing security for facilities and vessels. The assessment will evaluate how well the program addresses security risks in the maritime environment. The Secretary of Homeland Security must provide a comprehensive assessment of the transportation security card program, including an evaluation of security risks in the maritime environment, addressing deficiencies, and a cost-benefit analysis. A corrective action plan with benchmarks and potential program reforms must be submitted to relevant committees within 60 days. The Secretary of Homeland Security must provide a corrective action plan with benchmarks to address security risks in the transportation security card program. The plan will be reviewed by the Comptroller General to assess its implementation of recommendations and responsiveness to previous suggestions. The Secretary of Homeland Security must provide a corrective action plan with benchmarks to address security risks in the transportation security card program. The plan will be reviewed by the Comptroller General to assess its implementation of recommendations and responsiveness to previous suggestions. The Secretary may not issue a final rule on transportation security card readers until certain conditions are met, including approval from the Comptroller General and an updated list of compatible readers. The Comptroller General will provide oversight on the implementation of a corrective action plan for transportation security card readers. Reports will be submitted to relevant committees every six months for a 3-year period. No additional funds are authorized for this Act and its amendments, using existing amounts for implementation.
